Ten new coronavirus cases were confirmed in Gwynedd, according to the latest public health data.
Figures released by Public Health Wales reveal that as of 1pm on April 19, there were 10 new confirmed cases in Gwynedd, and no new cases in Anglesey.

articles.author: Fionnula Hainey, Brett Gibbons
articles.title: Hayfever sufferers warned not to confuse allergy with coronavirus - MyLondon
articles.description: Doctors have said people should consider whether problem is similar to previous bouts of the allergy before deciding whether to seek medical help
articles.content:
Hayfever sufferers are being warned their allergies produce symptoms that mirror those of coronavirus.
Coughing is a common reaction to pollen, which may then be confused for an outbreak of Covid-19.
